comments.text:
You live in Maesalong? It is one of our favourite places in the whole of 
Thailand :-D
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

comments.text:
Aww....hope everything is OK now. I live in California and we have lots 
Earthquakes, but most buildings here are built for Earthquake I can just 
imagined how Thail feel.
comments.author: Asiane Yang

comments.text:
+Asiane Yang This was our first earthquake experience. We were scared! But 
the damage is not too bad. The builders are coming to fix our house this 
week
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

comments.text:
;~). I have friends living nearby CRU, they also work there. I was there 
for 2 months last year. Love Chiangrai, but now that the 
Earthquake....Urghh....I'm in California now, and thought I could escape, 
but...lolz.
comments.author: Asiane Yang

comments.text: +Asiane Yang We will be here for a while, let us know :-)
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

comments.text:
Ah....if I ever get to come back to Chiangrai before you move, maybe we can 
have coffee ;)
comments.author: Asiane Yang

comments.text:
Chiang Rai is beautiful. We live there now. We will be here for a year we 
move somewhere else. Using the cameras takes some practice, we really enjoy 
making movies so we are always practicing :-)
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

comments.text:
Wow....all 3 cameras?... I have the GoPro Hero3, white. But I don't really 
know how to work it. I love the way you guys filmed all these. Very 
professional. Thank you for responding. I was just in Chiangrai this past 
Oct - Dec.
comments.author: Asiane Yang

comments.text:
We use a Canon 5D mk2 and Canon EOS 60D, also a GoPro Hero 3 black for the 
underwater shots :-)
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

top_comment.text:
Breath-taking Videography and editing & what a life you both have.. I want 
to get out of England.  Thanks for sharing We will be in Chiang Rai next 
year February 2016 for 4weeks.  Thanks for sharing

Tony & Laura﻿
top_comment.author: TONYLOUISVISION & VIDEOGRAPHY PLUS

comments.text:
That's it. Moving here to begin with was very tough, but we had little to 
lose. It was the best decision we ever made
comments.author: Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

comments.text: +Eight Miles from Home I know just have to get out of my comfort zone LOL
comments.author: TONYLOUISVISION & VIDEOGRAPHY PLUS
Eight Miles from Home (Jmayel Sacha El-haj)

captions.text: Maesalong Road Trip
Mae Salong A Father Daughter Story
I hadn't seen my dad In over fifteen months.
and it did feel like a long time.
I didn't really know

how I was going to react at the airport... I saw
him
then I got quite emotional
then when he walked through the doors i started crying.

because it had been so long since I'd
seen him
I did expect my dad to be the first one to visit us in thailand
on my side of the family
He visited us when we travelled the world, we met up with my dad in India

in all different kinds of places around the
world so yes

I did think that he would be the one to
come and see us
Huay Tung Tao Lake

my dad was so excited when we took him
into Burma
Me and Jmayel had to renew our visas

so we took him with us. and had never been
to that part of the world before either
he was really excited about getting a new stamp in his passport

my dad has lived in Dubai for the last ten
years so

thai weather didn't really affect
him that much
we went for a quick swim at ben guest house which was fun

and then we went to the saturday night walking
street for some shopping and got some
dinner
on the road trip to maesalong my dad cracked out his iPod
full of country music and being a bit of a
country music fan myself we had fun
I'm not too sure about Jmayel though
my dad really loved maesalong

if he had visited Thailand without us
being there he would never have gone
there himself
so being able to show him the amazing views
of the tea plantations
he just thought it was a really chilled out place and just what he needed

i've always been quite close with my dad
and

having him come out and stay with us in
Thailand
just strengthened that bond even more. my dad responded really well
to our life in Thailand

just been able to show him personally
and

take him to cafes that we go to. To show him
some of the

amazing scenery that we see every day
and it was really nice
he he got it

we had some really stunning sunset
while we were in maesalong

and at night the skies were really clear.
so clear that we could see the stars
and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony
watching the night sky.
I think coming to see jmayel and myself in Thailand's made my dad put into Perspective some things in his own life

and realized that there is other ways to
live

and I think he's now looking for more
relaxed way of life for himself

title: แม่สลอง Maesalong - A Father Daughter Story - 8MFH EP14
